entry.title: [a11y] Restrict AXModes more aggressively with IA2
entry.content:
We noticed that accessibility for web content gets enabled

for all users Chrome/Chromium users on Windows 11. The

common root cause we found so far is coming from the "windows

manager" view that shows up when you hover the full screen button on

Windows 11 (the one right next to the minimize or close buttons).

This view appears to be using UI Automation, and since UIA isn't

enabled in Chrome and Chromium (yet), it reverts back to using the

UIA to IA2 bridge.



The strangest part was that Microsoft Edge wasn't impacted by this.

While investigating, we found that the functions that get called

by UIA in Chromium (when UIA is enabled) and Edge (where UIA is

enabled) actually only turn on accessibility in the web content when

we are querying UIA information from a web content.



The functions that get called by IA2 do it differently: they enable

accessibility for the web content in all cases, regardless of whether

we are on a browser view node or a web content node.



In this CL, we restrict the IA2 AXMode enablement to also check

whether the node we're querying accessible information from is in

fact a web content node.



As Jacques mentioned in the comments below, one potential concern we

have with this change is that non-screenreader tools may be confused

as to why web contents are not immediately accessible, since even

after triggering web contents accessibility there is still a delay

while we serialize. A particularly brittle tool may fail during this

period, where they didn't before.



Since this fixes a bug that has a high impact on hundreds of millions

of users, we added a flag to effectively disable all the changes

introduced by this commit. If any issues come up because of this

commit, it's possible to disable it by launching Chromium with the

following flag:



--disable-features=AccessibilityRestrictiveIA2AXModes



Fixed: 1441213

Change-Id: I555fd28e4b15b82d6a7ee428cbd3f78452fd5144

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4493363

Commit-Queue: Benjamin Beaudry

Auto-Submit: Benjamin Beaudry

Reviewed-by: Jacques Newman

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1137486}

entry.title: Don't process FLING_CANCEL unless the previous event is FLING_START
entry.content:
In current logic, unnecessary FLING_CANCEL can affect focus.

Exit early instead.



This is a speculative fix. I've seen this a few times on my DUT,

but it's hard to repro and couldn't really figure out exactly how this

happens and also unable to find a good test case. (I tried various

cases that I can imagine, but could not find a case that changes

the focus in a unit test. The event may come from a lot lower level)



Bug: 1371493

entry.title: [css-flex] Remove default safe alignment for -webkit-box
entry.content:
-webkit-box defaulted to safe overflow for center alignment. That's

weird and differs from regular flexbox. So remove the safe overflow.



This makes Blink match Firefox.

entry.title: Consolidate aura::WindowObserver hooks used in exo::ExtendedDragSource
entry.content:
In CLs [1] and [2], the original use of OnWindowVisibilityChanging()

aura::WindowObserver hook was split into OnWindowVisibilityChanged().

This was needed to accommodate the needs to tab dragging logic when

TabletMode was ON and WebUITabStrip was OFF.

Now that WebUITabStrip is enabled 100% [3], we can unify those hooks

again without any functionality loss.



[1] https://crrev.com/c/3254858

[2] https://crrev.com/c/3365554

[3] https://crrev.com/c/3614046



R=nickdiego@igalia.com

entry.title: [Reland] Add `snap_action_source_` variable in WindowSnapWMEvent
entry.content:
There is no change with the original CL and the reland CL. The fix is in

the parent CL. Please see https://crrev.com/c/4491584 for the fix.



In this CL:

- Move the `snap_action_source_` from WindowState to WindowSnapWMEvent.

The `snap_action_source_` was a member variable in WindowState before,

but WindowSnapWMEvent should be a better place since we can log the

metrics more accurately when the WindowState handles the event and

the window state changes to a snapped window state.

- Add more different snap action sources so that the distribution is

more accurate.

- Note kSnapByWindowLayoutMenu and kLongPressCaptionButtonToSnap are

used to record snap usage from the window layout menu and the caption

snap buttons for ash browser window. Lacros window usage will be

handled separately in a future CL.



Bug: b/278761433

Change-Id: I25818a5ef614d5b4841410449ef07c14290cb0a1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4447659

entry.title: media: Fix CommandBufferHelperImpl ref count CHECK
entry.content:
Use a weak ptr instead of a scoped_reptr to check if the helper is still

alive after triggering its will destroy callbacks. Using a ref count

doesn't work because this code path can run in CommandBufferHelperImpl's

destructor, and start from one ref counted objects aren't allowed to

increment the ref after it reaches zero - this is the CHECK that fails.



Bug: 1413449

entry.title: Store copy of GURL in InstallableAmbientBadgeInfoBarDelegate
entry.content:
This issue was noticed while investigating dangling raw pointers, but

has existed prior to the re-write of the code to use them. A local

variable `url` in AmbientBadgeManager::ShowAmbientBadge() is being

passed by reference to InstallableAmbientBadgeInfoBarDelegate::Create(),

and in turn by reference to the InstallableAmbientBadgeInfoBarDelegate

constructor, and in turn, stored by reference in the class itself. The

local then goes out-of-scope leading to a dangling reference.



Copying a GURL is relatively inexpensive (it copies a string but

does not re-parse).



Bug: 1291138

Change-Id: I48706a5e48388b2b5abc6df9ddb47e3c705d61aa

entry.title: ash: Removes/fixes includes that were auto added
entry.content:
Includes should be full paths but sometimes vim/vscode auto adds a

relative path.



Ran (pseudo code), and some manual tweaks:



absolute_root = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), 'ash/wm')

for dir_path, dir_name_list, file_name_list in os.walk(absolute_root):

for file_name in file_name_list:

file_path = os.path.join(dir_path, file_name)

if ends with '.cc' or '.h':

with open(file_path, 'r+') as fh:

lines = fh.readlines()

fh.seek(0)

fh.truncate()

for line in lines:

match = REGEX_FOR_INCLUDE.search(line)

if not match or "<" in line or "/" in line:

fh.write(line)

fh.truncate()



Test: none

Bug: b/279973009

entry.title: Add Lacros flavor of DownloadStatusUpdater.
entry.content:
DownloadStatusUpdater notifies Fuchsia, Linux, Mac, and Windows of

download events so that they can render state in the appropriate

System UI surface. This CL creates a Lacros flavor for the same

purpose.



Moving forward, Chrome OS System UI will no longer observe raw

download events in order to render state in System UI surfaces.

Instead, Chrome OS System UI will update System UI surfaces as

instructed to do so by the DownloadStatusUpdater.



This CL only stubs in the DownloadStatusUpdater, but more metadata

will be added so that Chrome OS System UI surfaces can have a

consistent and symbiotic relationship with new download bubble UX in

the browser.



Design doc: http://shortn/_Qn9XZRHnST

entry.title: Revert "Allow utilities to preload libraries before sandbox lockdown"
entry.content:
This reverts commit fe96e5d8bdf603c73616ff87082352a562de1be7.



Reason for revert: This appears to be the cause of a build failure on win-asan that is closing the tree:



ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/win-asan/26430/overview



Original change's description:

> Allow utilities to preload libraries before sandbox lockdown

>

> Some utilities on Windows wrap dynamic libraries which might be

> distributed as components. Allowing these to load requires punching

> holes in the sandbox using file interceptions that are being phased

> out.

>

> This CL introduces a mechanism for service processes to specify a

> list of dll paths which will be loaded before the sandbox goes into

> lockdown. They can later be loaded by code using the same path, as

> Windows keeps them in memory.

>

> The mechanism uses a new opaque data transfer mechanism in the

> sandbox which will extend to different uses later. For

> now the list of DLLs is the only data transferred so this CL uses

> base::Pickle to serialize & transfer the DLLs to load.

>

> As loading arbitrary DLLs is a powerful capability a passkey is

> added for the new service process host option, and a file containing

> valid callers is added with OWNERS from the sandbox to ensure

> security review.

>

> A following CL will enable this behavior for screen_ai, but at this

> point only tests exercise these APIs

>

> The flow is roughly:

> ---

> In the browser/broker:-

>

> ServiceProcessHost gets a new option:

> .WithPreloadedLibraries

>

> UtilityProcessHost gets a new member:

> preload_libraries_

>

> UtilityProcessHost gives this to the UtilitySandboxedProcessLauncherDelegate

>

> UtilitySandboxedProcessLauncherDelegate turns a list of DLLs into an

> opaque blob and attaches it to the sandbox's TargetPolicy during

> PreSpawnTarget.

>

> The sandbox smuggles this blob into the target (previous CL).

>

> In the child/target:-

>

> The UtilityMain knows it might have a blob, so asks TargetServices.

>

> UtilityMain coordinates with its sandbox delegate, so knows that

> the blob is a pickled list of DLLs.

>

> UtilityMain loads these dlls before sandbox lockdown.

> ---

>

> Bug: 1435571

> Change-Id: Ided63f9d723811b66c183335b5533c84e9783a2a

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4471953

> Reviewed-by: Nasko Oskov

> Reviewed-by: Ken Rockot

> Reviewed-by: Will Harris

> Commit-Queue: Will Harris

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1137415}

entry.content:
V4L2VideoDecoder has an inner BitstreamIdGenerator to, well,

generate IDs. This CL uses instead base::IdType.



While taking a look at this simplification I noticed that the

generated ID is passed to the V4L2VideoDecoderBackend

implementations, but only one of those actually uses it. This CL

pushes the ID generation to that specific backend (the

stateless) and removes the unused logic in the other (stateful).



No functional changes intended.

entry.title: [Rounded Display] Ensure deletion of host_windows from WTH.
entry.content:
Currently, we depend on deletion of WTH to delete the host_window

(created by RoundedDisplayProvider) as it is owned by window hierarchy.



This behavior fails to delete the host window when we only have one

display and we remove it. The RoundedDisplayProvider is deleted

(if any), but instead of deleting the primary WTH, that should delete

the host_window of RoundedDisplayProvider, we temporarily store

the WTH and the attach to the next added display. Therefore we

never deleted the host_window in this case.



The CL makes the host window owned by RoundedDisplayProvider and the

provider deletes the host window on its destruction.



Bug: 1262970

Test: Covered by unittest.

ccameron@ fixed the issue in WriteSize() by writing a size_t as

two uint32_ts in crrev.com/1125851. However, we still have cases

not used.

entry.title: Still use GetTextForTooltipAndAccessibleName() for StarView
entry.content:
In the most recent CL [1], all IconView views were updated to directly

set their accessible name rather than providing it on demand via

GetTextForTooltipAndAccessibleName(). However, SetAccessibleName()

introduces an unexpected delay in the case of StarView when the user

quickly changes between already bookmarked and not bookmarked tabs.

Specifically, the tooltip string for the StarView can be outdated, as is

the case of crbug.com/1431838.



This delaying behavior of SetAccessibleName() is documented in CL [1] by

the original CL author too, that SetAccessibleName() should be used "if

this string never changes" [2]. In the meantime, the tooltip string of

StarView changes fairly frequently.



This CL reverts back to GetTextForTooltipAndAccessibleName() for

StarView.



[1] https://crrev.com/c/4365825

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/tags/115.0.5738.1:chrome/browser/ui/views/page_action/page_action_icon_view.h;l=101;bpv=1;bpt=0

entry.title: Allow utilities to preload libraries before sandbox lockdown
entry.content:
Some utilities on Windows wrap dynamic libraries which might be

distributed as components. Allowing these to load requires punching

holes in the sandbox using file interceptions that are being phased

out.



This CL introduces a mechanism for service processes to specify a

list of dll paths which will be loaded before the sandbox goes into

lockdown. They can later be loaded by code using the same path, as

Windows keeps them in memory.



The mechanism uses a new opaque data transfer mechanism in the

sandbox which will extend to different uses later. For

now the list of DLLs is the only data transferred so this CL uses

base::Pickle to serialize & transfer the DLLs to load.



As loading arbitrary DLLs is a powerful capability a passkey is

added for the new service process host option, and a file containing

valid callers is added with OWNERS from the sandbox to ensure

security review.



A following CL will enable this behavior for screen_ai, but at this

point only tests exercise these APIs



The flow is roughly:

---

In the browser/broker:-



ServiceProcessHost gets a new option:

.WithPreloadedLibraries



UtilityProcessHost gets a new member:

preload_libraries_



UtilityProcessHost gives this to the UtilitySandboxedProcessLauncherDelegate



UtilitySandboxedProcessLauncherDelegate turns a list of DLLs into an

opaque blob and attaches it to the sandbox's TargetPolicy during

PreSpawnTarget.



The sandbox smuggles this blob into the target (previous CL).



In the child/target:-



The UtilityMain knows it might have a blob, so asks TargetServices.



UtilityMain coordinates with its sandbox delegate, so knows that

the blob is a pickled list of DLLs.



UtilityMain loads these dlls before sandbox lockdown.

entry.title: Revert "Reland "graphite: Build Skia Graphite core by default""
entry.content:
This reverts commit add26fbabcb57688df6891918daac95b03915ad1.



Reason for revert: Breaks iOS build: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/ios-blink-dbg-fyi/4739/steps



Original change's description:

> Reland "graphite: Build Skia Graphite core by default"

>

> Add //gpu/config:workaround_list to skia_source_set deps to fix build.

>

> > Original change's description:

> > graphite: Build Skia Graphite core by default

> >

> > Using ENABLE_SKIA_GRAPHITE build flag is proving to be burdensome in

> > practice due to the many places where Viz/OOP-R would have to interact

> > with Graphite. Just limiting build flag checks to Dawn/Metal backend

> > specific code is more tractable. Binary cost increase for just building

> > Skia Graphite core should be modest.

> >

> > Enabling Graphite build by default caused gn check to fail because:

> > 1) Backend specific public includes were not split from private sources.

> > Fixed by https://skia-review.googlesource.com/c/skia/+/677136

> > 2) Shared GPU sources need to depend on private Graphite sources which

> > requires splitting up the skia_graphite source set into separate

> > public and private source sets - sources in the skia_graphite_private

> > can be included only in the skia component whereas public files in

> > skia_graphite_public are exported as skia component public_deps.

> >

> > Binary Size: Looking at the SuperSize report, most of the increase is

> > Graphite code (~104kB), and some large SkSL shader strings (~18kB).

> > Graphite is Skia's new GPU backend that's intended to replace

> > the current GPU backend (Ganesh) completely. This CL makes Graphite

> > core (i.e. not specific to any OS/native API) build by default in

> > Chromium. See above for why we want to do this instead of using

> > conditional build flags. Graphite will be rolled out in phases

> > targeting Mac and Windows first, followed by Android and ChromeOS.

> > Eventually, it is intended that Ganesh will be removed completely from

> > Chromium which will significantly reduce binary size.

> >

> > Binary-Size: See commit description.

> > Fuchsia-Binary-Size: See commit description.

> > Bug: 1429361

> > Change-Id: Icd8f3343cde6c3b1e63f7e317b60b8a122e159d2

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4456509

> > Commit-Queue: Sunny Sachanandani

entry.title: [Nearby Presence] Register with the Nearby Presence server
entry.content:
The first time registration flow with the server is as follows (based

on go/cros-nearby-presence-credential-web-integration):

1. Register the local device with the NP server to make itself known

as a device associated with the user's GAIA

2. Generate the local device's credentials using data returned from the

server registration and upload to the server

3. Download remote devices' credentials and save them to the NP library



This CL does 1: register with the NP server via an UpdateDevice RPC.

Using an OnDemandScheduler to ensure connectivity with the request,

the CredentialManager schedulers an immediate task to register with the

server. After 5 failures, the CredentialManager stops exponential retries

and notifies callers of a failure. On success, the CredentialManager

saves the user name and image url to the LocalDeviceDataProvider and

notifies of success (although this will change in following CL's).



Following this CL, on success, the CredentialManager will continue to

2 and 3 before notifying of success. Once all steps are complete,

a manual test will be added on the debug page.



Tested: Unit tests only, no manual testing.

Bug: b/276307539

Change-Id: I730785e4250f26bc4dae991936b0a18274210d2b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4420708

Reviewed-by: Ryan Hansberry

entry.title: Fix variations crash keys race condition
entry.content:
Noticed this while investigating crbug.com/1440498. I don't think this

happens much, if at all, but thought I'd fix it for completeness sake.

I also looked at the other field trial observers and the rest seem

to not suffer from this race condition, so this CL only fixes this one.

entry.title: iwa: Updating Page Info IWA-logic with UrlIdentity API
entry.content:
Updating IWA-logic inside Page Info with UrlIdentity API.



- Adds `IsIsolatedWebApp()` and `GetSubjectName()` to PageInfoDelegate.



- Removes `GetWebAppShortName()` from PageInfoDelegate.



- Adds enum option |kOmitSchemePathAndTrivialSubdomains| to UrlIdentity.



- Removes `GetSiteNameOrAppNameToDisplay()`,

`SetIsolatedWebAppNameForTesting()`, `GetSimpleSiteName()`,

`isolated_web_app_name_`, `is_isolated_web_app_for_testing_` from

PageInfo.



- Removes |PageInfoTest.IsolatedWebAppStatus| unit test. Moving the

logic to |PageInfoBubbleViewIsolatedWebAppBrowserTest.

InvokeUi_AppNameIsDisplayedInsteadOfOriginForIsolatedWebApps_REV2|.

entry.title: [Metadata][VCN][Dialog] Fetch card icon directly on the Java side
entry.content:
Currently, the card art/network icon for the VCN enrollment dialog is

sent down from the native side as a bitmap. This results in poor quality

images.



Sync down the card art URL/network icon Id from the native side, and

fetch the image on the Java side.

After: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/C4dZzRLEgaGmd6y



Note: This dialog is used for VCN enrollment from the Settings page.

entry.title: Allow dumping storage statistics in Chrome Canary
entry.content:
Adds a setting to the Experimental bundle which dumps information for

all files and directories within the application Documents directory.

This allows a developer to analyze the contents of their Documents

directory on builds which are not inspectable locally through Xcode.

entry.title: Disable kProcessPerSiteUpToMainFrameThreshold in portal browser test
entry.content:
Some tests like TaskManagerOrderingOfDependentRows assumes that the

ordering of the task manager rows are fixed. This is true iff tabs

don't share processes. Disable kProcessPerSiteUpToMainFrameThreshold,

which does allow tabs to share processes, in PortalBrowserTest.

LUCI Bisection identified this CL as the culprit of a build failure. See the analysis: https://luci-bisection.appspot.com/analysis/b/8782540362709408593



Sample failed build: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8782540362709408593

Original change's description:

> Remove LazyImageLoading feature/REF

>

> This patch removes the feature flags (both a content feature and a

> blink runtime enabled feature) for lazy image loading, which has been

> enabled by default for many years. There's some non-trivial test

> cleanup because we used to have a feature that automatically applied

> lazy loading to images, which required testing both regular (developer

> controlled lazy loading) and automatic lazy loading. This patch is

> cleanup with no change in behavior.

entry.title: Fixes the crash https://crbug.com/1435564.
entry.content:
Updates the parent of host windows of RoundedDisplayProvider when a

primary display is being removed. The crash was happening as we deleted

the host_window of RoundedDisplayProvider prematurely.



When deleting the primary display, instead of deleting the primary

host, we move the primary host to another display and delete the other

host instead. Since we swap the hosts, we need to correctly update what

host the RoundedDisplayProvider is attached to.



- Adds unit test that fails without the fix in this patchset.



Bug: 1435564

Test: Verified manually and added unittest.

entry.title: Remove LazyImageLoading feature/REF
entry.content:
This patch removes the feature flags (both a content feature and a

blink runtime enabled feature) for lazy image loading, which has been

enabled by default for many years. There's some non-trivial test

cleanup because we used to have a feature that automatically applied

lazy loading to images, which required testing both regular (developer

controlled lazy loading) and automatic lazy loading. This patch is

cleanup with no change in behavior.

entry.title: [Performance Controls] Update discard timers when pref is changed
entry.content:
Following up from crrev.com/c/4475131, after discussing with PM/eng we

decided to fully reset each tabs' discard timers to the new time before

discard whenever the discard time pref is changed, or when high

efficiency mode is set to use the timer based policy. This changes the

current behavior, so that when HEM is enabled, it is no longer possible

for tabs to be immediately discarded.



Context:

docs.google.com/document/d/1sGEjdfO588LHwmg6mr5z99KZJ-wFjYVBN2UvgBJPLdk

entry.title: Organize gnrt sources
entry.content:
* The "lib" target is moved to a subdirectory, separate from the

executable sources.

* "gnrt gen" implementation is moved to gen.rs

* Shared utility functions are moved to util.rs



main.rs was overgrown, so functionality should be split out. Putting

the lib target in a subdir makes clear that it's a separate target

entry.title: Reland "DeskButton: Add desk button widget to shelf"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 7922bc4fbbdac6b266809633706bb6f6e2f9786c



ShelfViewGestureTapTest.InterruptContextMenuShowByItemRemoval was failing. The test starts with 2 app icons in the shelf, it deletes the first one and then immediately clicks on the second one. With the hotseat window targeter now in place the test would get the bounds of the second app and try to click it while it was still animating, and the targeter would pass the click onto the shelf background instead. I added a task environment fast forward to fix the issue, but the amount of time wasn't enough and the test was flaky. This fix increases that amount of time.



Original change's description:

> DeskButton: Add desk button widget to shelf

>

> Add the widget on the shelf that will later be populated with the

> chevron buttons for switching desks and the desk name.

>

> Bug: b:272382271

entry.title: [NTP] Do not refresh background if extension theme
entry.content:
Background was continuing to refresh if a theme was installed. Before

color extraction it wasn't noticed since the background would

be changing behind the scenes. Now it is actually updating the theme

color when it does a refresh, which removes the extension theme.



- Added a check in the refresh function to exit out if there is an

extension theme in use.

- Added test for above check and updated related

NtpCustomBackgroundService unit test code so the new code could match

newer NTP unit test code.

entry.title: Prefix webview classes with "WV." to reduce confusion in stacks
entry.content:
It's easy to identify webview frames in an obfuscated stack because

the source file part (in parentheses) is "chromium-$VERSION".



However, when deobfuscation is applied, the part in parentheses is

not considered, and without a prefix, can be incorrectly mapped to

a class from the embedding app.



It costs <16kb to prefix all classes with "WV.", so seems worth

doing to avoid embedding apps from getting incorrect deobfuscated

frames.



Bug: 1434742

Change-Id: I90b7710adb1906de5da82225616ca1cec0017755

entry.title: Request layout after existing fullscreen for PCCTs.
entry.content:
After exiting full screen, side panel CCTs would have the wrong

position for buttons. This was because the captured toolbar bitmap

was being shown, instead of the Android View.



This happens because the BrowserControlsManager is setting the

Toolbar's visibility to INVISIBLE instead of GONE. And so no layout

is triggered when it goes back to VISIBLE. And there's no other way of

telling the SurfaceFlinger to gather transparent regions. This results

in Android thinking it doesn't need to draw any Views, which is why

the captured bitmap is still visible.



To get around this, send a container visibility signal into pcct logic

to request request a new layout for just this scenario. No tracking of

exiting full screen was used because the surfaces this issue is

affecting don't scroll off the toolbar.



Bug: 1430948

Change-Id: Ibfbcd7b7b6fe88548d553646ad90582fdd8189cc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4484984

entry.title: Reland "graphite: Build Skia Graphite core by default"
entry.content:
Add //gpu/config:workaround_list to skia_source_set deps to fix build.



> Original change's description:

> graphite: Build Skia Graphite core by default

>

> Using ENABLE_SKIA_GRAPHITE build flag is proving to be burdensome in

> practice due to the many places where Viz/OOP-R would have to interact

> with Graphite. Just limiting build flag checks to Dawn/Metal backend

> specific code is more tractable. Binary cost increase for just building

> Skia Graphite core should be modest.

>

> Enabling Graphite build by default caused gn check to fail because:

> 1) Backend specific public includes were not split from private sources.

> Fixed by https://skia-review.googlesource.com/c/skia/+/677136

> 2) Shared GPU sources need to depend on private Graphite sources which

> requires splitting up the skia_graphite source set into separate

> public and private source sets - sources in the skia_graphite_private

> can be included only in the skia component whereas public files in

> skia_graphite_public are exported as skia component public_deps.

>

> Binary Size: Looking at the SuperSize report, most of the increase is

> Graphite code (~104kB), and some large SkSL shader strings (~18kB).

> Graphite is Skia's new GPU backend that's intended to replace

> the current GPU backend (Ganesh) completely. This CL makes Graphite

> core (i.e. not specific to any OS/native API) build by default in

> Chromium. See above for why we want to do this instead of using

> conditional build flags. Graphite will be rolled out in phases

> targeting Mac and Windows first, followed by Android and ChromeOS.

> Eventually, it is intended that Ganesh will be removed completely from

> Chromium which will significantly reduce binary size.

>

> Binary-Size: See commit description.

> Fuchsia-Binary-Size: See commit description.

> Bug: 1429361

> Change-Id: Icd8f3343cde6c3b1e63f7e317b60b8a122e159d2

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4456509

> Commit-Queue: Sunny Sachanandani

> Reviewed-by: Saifuddin Hitawala

> Reviewed-by: Kevin Lubick

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1136876}



Binary-Size: See commit description.

Fuchsia-Binary-Size: See commit description.

entry.title: Fix AutofillInteractiveTest.* flakiness
entry.content:
This CL reverts the change to FillElementWithValue() made by

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4337772



The test flakiness is caused by calling blur() too early. blur() was

added in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4337772

in order to observe onchange instead of oninput event.

The purpose of switching from observing oninput to observing onchange in

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4337772

was refactoring.



BUG=1431143

entry.title: Remove `set_disconnect_handler` from public API of `QRImageGenerator`.
entry.content:
The "Rusty QR Code Generation" project requires that the API surface is

mostly mojo-agnostic, so this CL replaces the public

`QRImageGenerator::set_disconnect_handler` API with an internal usage of

`mojo::WrapCallbackWithDefaultInvokeIfNotRun`.



In addition to changing the QR-related code, this CL also updates the

doc comments in `mojo/public/cpp/bindings/callback_helpers.h` to capture

the threading guarantees that have been discussed in

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/chromium-mojo/c/ExmXmiF6gOU/m/AD77IWXVAQAJ



Bug: 1431991

Change-Id: I56095c4502ac58ead37fb2e4ab78e1069d43c7bf

entry.title: [Performance] Change UPTM and settings UI to use enum memory saver pref
entry.content:
This CL simultaneously updates the user performance tuning manager and

the performance settings page toggle button to use the newly introduced

kHighEfficiencyModeState enum pref, instead of the boolean pref

kHighEfficiencyModeEnabled. Turning on memory saver now sets the enum

pref to kEnabledOnTimer, and the UPTM and other consumers will treat

kEnabled the same as kEnabledOnTimer.



Additionally, this CL enables the UPTM to migrate the enum pref from

the boolean pref on startup. In order to continue supporting the

boolean enterprise policy HighEfficiencyModeEnabled, the previously

created policy handler mapping it to the enum pref is registered to

the handlers list, replacing the simple policy map to the boolean pref.

The mapped value of the policy when enabled has been changed to

enabled on timer to match the migration value.



Bug: 1424220

Change-Id: I31773123413970c44e60ecd85656d879dbe1b454

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4363128
